translated: The Chapter on Pairs, the Text on the Pairs of Terms

original: Naarūpāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naarūpāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: na arūpāvacaram dhammam paṭicca na arūpāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: With a states belonging to the form-less world as condition, a states belonging to the form-less world arises, by way of root-cause condition … one.

original: Nanaarūpāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanaarūpāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na na arūpāvacaram dhammam paṭicca na na arūpāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a states not belonging to the form-less world as condition, a states not belonging to the form-less world arises, by way of root-cause condition … three.

original: Naarūpāvacarañca nanaarūpāvacarañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naarūpāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na arūpāvacaram ca na na arūpāvacaram ca dhammam paṭicca na arūpāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a states belonging to the form-less world and a states not belonging to the form-less world as condition, a states belonging to the form-less world arises, by way of root-cause condition … one. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke dve …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke dve pe avigate pañca
translated: With a root-cause as condition, five. With an object as condition, two. … With a nutriment as condition, two. … With an element as condition, five.
